sections.title: ROLLBACK
sections.text: ROLLBACK â€” abort the current transaction

sections.title: Synopsis
sections.text:
CODE:

ROLLBACK [ WORK | TRANSACTION ] [ AND [ NO ] CHAIN ]

sections.title: Description
sections.text: ROLLBACKrolls back the current transaction and causes all the updates made by the transaction to be discarded.

sections.title: Parameters
sections.text:
Optional key words. They have no effect.
IfAND CHAINis specified, a new (not aborted) transaction is immediately started with the same transaction characteristics (seeSET TRANSACTION) as the just finished one. Otherwise, no new transaction is started.

sections.title: Notes
sections.text:
UseCOMMITto successfully terminate a transaction.
IssuingROLLBACKoutside of a transaction block emits a warning and otherwise has no effect.ROLLBACK AND CHAINoutside of a transaction block is an error.

sections.title: Examples
Compatibility
sections.text: The commandROLLBACKconforms to the SQL standard. The formROLLBACK TRANSACTIONis a PostgreSQL extension.
